DataElement.preferredName: Barthel Index of Activities of Daily Living 6 1965 Version Walk on Level Surface Score 2 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An observation of a person's ability to walk on level surfaces, using a 2 point scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Barthel Index of Activities of Daily Living Walk on Level Surface Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A clinical assessment tool designed to measure functional independence and need for assistance in mobility, self-care, and activities of daily living._A question about an individual's ability to walk on a level surface._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Barthel Index 1965 Version Walk on Level Surface Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to walk on a level surface independent of help from others.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to walk on a level surface independent of help from others.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Needs Help to Walk on Level Surface

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Needs Help to Walk on Level Surface
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to walk on a level surface with help.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to walk on a level surface with help.
